subject: Using JUnit to test CORBA objects...
msgSnippet: Hello All, I have a client and server application that use the JDK 1.4 ORB to communicate between them. I am interested in the following: 1. Easily obtaining
messageBody:
Hello All,

I have a client and server application that use the JDK 1.4 ORB to
communicate between them. I am interested in the following:

1. Easily obtaining implemented CORBA server objects into my client
for testing, and

2. Testing the CORBA server objects in the server itself (and in the
server's JVM)

I've looked at Apache's Cactus and found it only offering testing on
EJB-type solutions. I've also looked at possibly extending the Cactus
RedirectorProxy, but am not sure how to implement for CORBA use
(rather than Servelet, JSP, etc.).

Any insight into a solution to my questions would be greatly
appreciated.

Thank you for your time and response.

-Rick
